answers.answer: Just expand that to be an Endo that is a good thyroid doctor.  Many are not because they specialize in diabetes, not thyroid, or they treat lab test numbers exclusively, instead of patient symptoms.  What you need to know is whether the Endo  will treat your symptoms by testing and adjusting the actual biologically active thyroid hormones (FT3 and FT4)  with whatever type of medication (T4 or T3) is necessary to relieve symptoms, without being constrained by resultant TSH levels.  In my opinion that is the question that should be asked about  any prospective thyroid doctor, before making an appointment.

question: After having a thyroidectomy due to cancer, what type of doctor do I go to, to monitor my thyroid levels?
